COMMENT_TX: $the ball caromed off Tim Lincecum's left leg
$pitcher Tim Lincecum fielded the ball between the mound and the 3B line; he ran Michael Young back to 3B but never threw the ball to Juan Uribe, who was standing ready to catch and tag Young
$2B Ian Kinsler ran a long way into RF to catch the popup; Freddy Sanchez ran towards 3B and then slipped trying to get back to 2B
$Bengie Molina becomes the second player after Lonnie Smith in 1985 to play in the World Series against a team for which he played in the same season
$Cliff Lee faked a bunt attempt and then took a choppy swing to hit the ball into left-center
$for the second time in the game, the ball caromed off Tim Lincecum's leg
Rangers pitcher C.J. Wilson left with a blister on the middle finger of his left hand
$the first World Series game played in Arlington, TX; ceremonial pitch by Rangers president Nolan Ryan (68 MPH at 63 years old)
$Travis Ishikawa scraped his chin on his head-first dive into 3B
Rangers pitcher Alexi Ogando left the game due to a left oblique strain after second pitch to Uribe
